column2: Health Improved!, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My first few cases of Gout was in my ankle, toes,fingers and elbow. Colchicine helps tremendously! I am afraid to travel anywhere without it. I take 0.6mg once a day. Soft bowels, no runny diarrhea, no stomach cramps - not bad at all, and no nausea. I take the medication around 9:00pm, before bedtime. Bowel movements begin the next morning. The benefits of pain relief are worth it.  Colchicine relieves MOST of the pain. I no longer take 800mg Advil/Ibuprophen for pain. Colchicine takes care of the night pain in my ankle that wakes me up around 2:00am. I sometimes have a little pain, but no pain like I had prior to my doctor prescribing Colchicine. The benefits definitely out way the risks.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am female, age 65 and have had gout for 10 years.  My father, his mother and my brother also have/had gout.  I have attacks/flairs in my fingers, wrist, instep and lower spine(very rare).  I take Allopurinal 600mg. daily and take Colchicine 0.6mg daily for 5 days when I have a flair.  I have 6 to 10 flairs a year.  I go to a Rhematologist for treatment of my gout.  The Colchicine works very well for the flairs.  The Rhematologist does not want to increase the Allopurinal since it is kind of hard on the kidneys and he says I am still young-nice to hear.  I incourge everyone to go to a Rhematologist for diagnosis/treatment, that is one of their specialities.

column2: tj56, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was a 15 year user of Colchicine from West-ward, and completely satisfied with the drug's performance. I took 0.6 mg/day, and a second pill if I felt a gout attack coming.  On a few ocasions a third pill was needed, which did lead to diarrhea.  All of my gout attacks were brought on by excessive strain to my feet, either athletic activity or physical labor, and Colchicine was an inexpensive, safe cure.  Pain free within hours.Then the FDA got involved and approved Colcrys from URLpharma.  With their FDA approval URL enjoined West-ward from making the real colchicine.  Then with their government sanctioned monopoly they raised the price 2700% (from $21 to $556 for a 90 day supply).  You gotta love our government's involvement in health care.Well after two months on Colcrys, I have had two of the worst gout attacks ever.  Both totally out of the blue (no excessive strain).  I am in day ten of my first ever gout attack in my ankle, and Colcrys has been totally ineffective.  At the first sign of gout I took a second and then a third pill, with no releif.  The second day four pills, and three more on the third day, still nearly dibilitating pain at the end of the day.  My Dr. has been on vacation, but I will see him in a few hours.  My message will be "Colcrys is crap, thank you FDA."

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Colchicine almost a year ago for FMF. It took me a while to figure out a dose that worked for me, right now I'm taking two 0.6mg pills a day. I have severe side effects such as severe diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and dizziness. But anyone who really needs this medication and anyone this medication helps will tell you that the side effects are worth it. FMF attacks are unbearable. There were so many times I wanted to die just to stop the pain, but with Colchicine I don't have as many attacks and I feel better on a day to day basis. I take Phenergan and Lomotil for the nausea/vomiting and diarrhea, so I'm fine taking Colchicine. Hope this helps.

column9: For years I had knee pain, I would think that my knee was out of socket, I did not know that My grandfather and my Uncle suffered from gout. I am prescribed .6 mg but only take 1/2 a tablet a day.  A week ago I thought I would try to drop the dosage completely, within 5 days I had a huge attack in my knee could hardly move or walk.  At that time I needed to take up to 2 pills every 8 hours. totaling 9 pills in two day.  Thank god for this pill.   I have taken Allupirnal(not sure of spelling) but within days I have another attack and must go back to colchecine.  I have been hospitalized for gout when I first started taking Allupirnal It cause my leg to swell to twice its size.  Colchecine does work but it does cause diahria when you have to take large amounts.  that is a small price in my book.

column1: Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: dcmcl33, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been an athlete for 55 years and I experience gout as a running back in college.  While I did not know what I was experiencing, I suffered through many games where I thought my pain was an injury.  Through the years I have discovered that intense physical activity agravates the gout (at least I experience many attacks after long and/or hard workouts).  The pain has been in my feet (instep, arch, toes), hand (fingers, knuckles), wrist (feels like a sprain) and elbow.  None of these are at the same time, but the pain can shift from one area to the next.  Others do not understand the degree of the pain but they can certainly observe that I am in a great deal of pain because of my inability to move during a flare-up.  I have used indocin for years during "attacks" but I get headaches with that drug.  I experience five or six strong flare-up each year.  The doctor started me on colchicine and the pain decreased immediately.  I have had no side effects.  I have read many reviews on this site and it seems as though the frequency of use has been a factor in many of the excerpts.  I take only two a day, one early and one mid-day.  I have experienced no adverse problems.  Believe me when I say that I do not take medication.  I do not take any other drugs and I only use colchicine during the attacks and for few days afterwards.  Again, as I read these reviews it seems as though some medical professionals are precribing large doses.  Maybe, like anything else moderation is the secret.  Also, after reading some of these reviews, I realize how much I appreciate my doctor.

column9: I was diagnosed with gout in Oct 2009 having chronic foot, ankle and knee pain started to interfere with my workout, md started me on pain meds that helped but also had uric acid level drawn,indeed they were elevated, my mother had gout so my labs and history were positive.... going along taking allopurinol and 4 days ago thanksgiving day i ate raw cauliflower and in about 2 hours I was in EXCRUCIATING PAIN i called my Dr and she phoned in colchicine prescription I began taking 2x per day for 3 days as md recommended, I was able to walk much better with the first dose! and progressively improved today is the first day without using and i actually am getting a twinge in my foot again but remember I have been having low level chronic pain (as i think back over a year) so the use of colchicine for the flare was great no stomach upset whatsoever ( i have an iron gut)  I have to see how this progresses if I will only use for flare or wind up on daily doses it works like a miricle and is very inexpensive

The Dr. prescribed both medications at the same time but has since raised the Colchine to 2 pills a day. I have had heartburn and gas but no diarrhea. Also have had dizziness, drowsy/sleepy feeling as well as a slight nauseous feeling. Not sure which prescription is causing the side effects. Maybe both?

column1: Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: colchicine, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my 3rd and worse bout with gout.  My Dr. prescribed this medication and forewarned me that it MAY cause diarahea.  He suggested one 0.6 mg pill every four hours instead of every one to two hours.  It took just a little longer but after taking this for 18 hours the front of my foots swelling has gone down 50% and the pain has subsided by over 75%.  When this attack is over , he is starting my on Allopurinol to avoid this in the future.In short, Colchicine is a god sent medication.

column1: Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to Urgent Care on a Sunday morning because of severe pain in my left foot due to Gout.  I was given Colchicine .6mg and told to take 2 tablets immediately and one every 1-2 hours till the pain subsided or until I developed Diarrhea.  The pain went away by bedtime after taking 9 tablets.  Monday morning I had explosive diarrhea and by noon had developed vomiting and severe muscle pain in my back and side. I received a call from Medco Health, my medication provider, about 2:00pm who told me of the side effects, one was the interaction it has with Zocor which causes the degeneration of muscle fiber causing severe pain.  I traded one pain for another.  The diarrhea and vomiting subsided after 3 days.  After a week, I'm still fighting the muscle pain with Oxycodine, but it does seem to be getting better. LOOK FOR AN ALTERNATIVE DRUG!!!!!

However the last time I had an attack I was forced to seek medical treatment. My doctor precribed Colchicine & to make a long story short, I had almost 90% relief within 12 hours. No side affects whatsoever. It works.

column2: jeff, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Not only has this drug used on a daily basis eliminated all experiences with gout, I had a fairly bad case of psoriasis on my hands.  With the use of colchicine my hands completely cleared.  Just to make sure that I was not experiencing some new and temporary reaction that led to this psoratic relief, I discontinued the use of the colchincine.  The psoriasis in my hand return almost immediately.  Upon returning to the use of colchicine, my hands cleared up once again.Every doctor I have talked to dismisses this because they say that gout and psoriasis are not related.  Thats fine, but the bottom line is that this drug suppresses both my gout and psoriasis.

column1: Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: Gouch, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took Colchicine for a gout attack and ended up in the hospital. Diarrhea and dehydration were severe. A portion of my small bowel stopped working for a while. The gout pain droped from a 10+ to 8-9. The jury is still out on colchicine for the prevention. I find drinking water 3 to 4 liters daily works well however, I wouldn't recommend this without talking for your MD(this much fluid could be devastating to a person in CHF). I now use water in theory of diluting the concentration of the uric acid in my bloodstream and a big whopping dose of IM steroids when an attack occurs. I now only have about one to two attacks per year.

column1: Inflammation of the Joints due to Gout
column2: las, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: For 3 yrs. I suffered with pain in my feet, when I would get up in am I could barely walk down steps.  The pain just got worse and my joints hurt and muscle pain. I work for a doctor but no insurance so I talked to her and at first we thought fibromyalgia. I just lived with the pain.  Taking ibuprofen, using hot packs etc. Then in Nov. 07' my great toe on my left foot turned a little red and very painful. I thought gout so I talked to the doctor again and she looked at it and said possible gout and Rx'ed me with colchicine for 5 days. AFTER 2 DAYS I WAS PAIN FREE!! NO PAIN IN MY FEET,SHOULDERS,ELBOWS,KNEES,HANDS,MUSCLES. ANYWHERE. I COULD RUN UP AND DOUM THE STEPS.  This was a miricle to me. I have been pain free up till about 2 wks. ago. I am breaking down and giong to have the uric acid blood test. If it is gout then she will Rx allipurinol(sp)? If I dont have gout then I dont know what I do have but colchicine was my miricle drug.

column9: this medication has definetly helped my gout pain, but the side effect of naseau has been bothersome..hv to take additional meds to control that too....well worth it to stop the excruciating pain in my knees, wrists, and feet.i recommend it.
I have FMF and have been on Colchicine for over 4 years now and its a miracle pill. I don't know what I would do without it. It has given me NO side effects!!Very inexpensive and easy to swallow...

column2: moldy, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took this drug back in the 80's for gout and it worked. In 2004 my pharmacy mis labled the instructions, instead of one pill every hour until vomiting, etc. they told me to take it every 5 minutes until vomiting.  Well, I took the whole bottle and puked for two days until I went to the hospital. About died but okay now, sort of. Had to take one a day to keep the gout away but my doc said to stop taking it after 4 months. Now I have gout again and after reading the reviews I see the reason for my doc to tell me to stop. Don't know what I can take now even with 400 mg of allopruinal a day, I can get gout just by talking about it. Can't use NSAIDs due to blood thinners, etc. Ouch! Can take good pain meds cause the docs don't like to prescribe it so what the hell?

column2: jw200sx, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: after taking the drug for over a year, perhaps 2, I was diagnosed with MDS with low white blood cell counts, low platelets, low HCT, low HGL and others.  Later I came to find out that Colchicine suppresses bone marrow function.  Conventional reasoning said that you would have to take a lot to have this happen.  I took a daily dose of .65 mg for gout.  Allopurinol is supposed to be more effective for gout, but at the time, I was taking Imuran which does not get along with Colchicine.  I don't take it now and it will take 3 to 6 months to find out if it was the culprit in my miserable energyless existence.

column9: I HAVE FMF AND FIND THIS TREATMENT WONDERFUL.

column2: taylorbh1, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Colchicine about 6 weeks ago for the treatment of Gout. It has worked for me, but I almost died due to complications brought on by using this drug.  I am a dialysis patient and it caused my immune system to crash by supressing my bone marrow production of both white and red blood cells and platelets.  I developed high fever and headaches for lack of red blood cells carrying oxygen to the brain. I spent 6 days in the hospital until my white blood cell count came up to atleast 2.7 before they would release me. I am still waiting for results from the bone marrow biopsy and my primary care doctor called the hematologist to let him know about the Colchicine side effects and they are both confident that the drug was the cause of all symptoms.  Hopefully they will be able to find some other form of treatment for the gout without the adverse effects on my immune system and kidneys. I am confident they will.
